abstract_summ: Around a fifth of the global population is in lockdown as covid-19 cases continue to rise, reports Jessica HamzelouGoing out into the natural world is good for your health and mind, and you can still get some of the same benefits even when stuck inside, says Graham LawtonWith more than a third of the world living under covid-19 restrictions, it is time to decide what happens next, reports Graham LawtonThe country is tantalisingly close to wiping out covid-19.David Attenborough's latest film A Life on Our Planet is a powerful and unusually personal call to action, finds Timothy RevellI Never ThoughtAlice Klein reportsVictorian corpse displays sparked John Troyer's interest in how humans use technology around dead bodies.He explores our fascination with death and its impact on lifeI Had "Moral Courage," until COVID-19 Happened.
title_summ: I Had "Moral Courage," until COVID-19 Happened.World in lockdownNature of a lockdownHow do we leave lockdown?New Zealand's successQ & AAttenborough's rallying cryINever Thought
